meanings.definition: Depriving someone of the right to vote.
meanings.sent1: The disenfranchisement of certain groups in the election led to unfair results.
meanings.sent2: Voter disenfranchisement can have a significant impact on the outcome of an election.
meanings.sent3: The disenfranchisement of the class clown from voting seemed like a joke at first.
meanings.sent4: The silence of disenfranchisement in the voting booth spoke louder than any words.
meanings.sent5: The image of disenfranchisement was etched in the minds of the citizens, urging them to fight for change.

meanings.definition: Exclusion from a privilege or right.
meanings.sent1: The disenfranchisement from the exclusive club left him feeling left out.
meanings.sent2: Being denied entry to the event was a form of disenfranchisement.
meanings.sent3: The disenfranchisement from the VIP section made her laugh at the irony.
meanings.sent4: The velvet rope symbolized the disenfranchisement of those without special passes.
meanings.sent5: The feeling of disenfranchisement lingered long after the event was over.
